verses.verse: Ἦσαν <WG1510> Ēsan were ( The Parable of the Lost Sheep) δὲ <WG1161> de Now αὐτῷ <WG846> autō - ἐγγίζοντες <WG1448> engizontes gathering around πάντες <WG3956> pantes all οἱ <WG3588> hoi the τελῶναι <WG5057> telōnai tax collectors καὶ <WG2532> kai and οἱ <WG3588> hoi - ἁμαρτωλοὶ <WG268> hamartōloi sinners ἀκούειν <WG191> akouein to listen to αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou [Jesus] .

καὶ <WG2532> kai So διεγόγγυζον <WG1234> diegongyzon began to grumble οἵ <WG3588> hoi the τε <WG5037> te - Φαρισαῖοι <WG5330> Pharisaioi Pharisees καὶ <WG2532> kai and οἱ <WG3588> hoi - γραμματεῖς <WG1122> grammateis scribes λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes - ὅτι <WG3754> hoti - : Οὗτος <WG3778> Houtos “ This [man] ἁμαρτωλοὺς <WG268> hamartōlous sinners προσδέχεται <WG4327> prosdechetai welcomes καὶ <WG2532> kai and συνεσθίει <WG4906> synesthiei eats with αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois them . ”

Εἶπεν <WG2036> Eipen [Jesus] told δὲ <WG1161> de Then πρὸς <WG4314> pros . . . αὐτοὺς <WG846> autous them τὴν <WG3588> tēn - παραβολὴν <WG3850> parabolēn parable ταύτην <WG3778> tautēn this λέγων <WG3004> legōn - :

Τίς <WG5101> Tis “ What ἄνθρωπος <WG444> anthrōpos man ἐξ <WG1537> ex among ὑμῶν <WG4771> hymōn you , ἔχων <WG2192> echōn [if] he has ἑκατὸν <WG1540> hekaton a hundred πρόβατα <WG4263> probata sheep καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀπολέσας <WG622> apolesas loses ἐξ <WG1537> ex of αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn them , ἓν <WG1520> hen one οὐ <WG3756> ou does not καταλείπει <WG2641> kataleipei leave τὰ <WG3588> ta the ἐνενήκοντα <WG1768> enenēkonta ninety-nine ἐννέα <WG1767> ennea . . . ἐν <WG1722> en in τῇ <WG3588> tē the ἐρήμῳ <WG2048> erēmō pasture καὶ <WG2532> kai and πορεύεται <WG4198> poreuetai go ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi after τὸ <WG3588> to the [one] ἀπολωλὸς <WG622> apolōlos that is lost , ἕως <WG2193> heōs until εὕρῃ <WG2147> heurē he finds αὐτό <WG846> auto it ?

καὶ <WG2532> kai And εὑρὼν <WG2147> heurōn when he finds [it] , ἐπιτίθησιν <WG2007> epitithēsin he joyfully puts [it] ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi on τοὺς <WG3588> tous - ὤμους <WG5606> ōmous shoulders , αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his χαίρων <WG5463> chairōn . . .

καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἐλθὼν <WG2064> elthōn comes εἰς <WG1519> eis vvv τὸν <WG3588> ton vvv οἶκον <WG3624> oikon home , συνκαλεῖ <WG4779> synkalei [and] calls together τοὺς <WG3588> tous [his] φίλους <WG5384> philous friends καὶ <WG2532> kai and τοὺς <WG3588> tous - γείτονας <WG1069> geitonas neighbors λέγων <WG3004> legōn to tell αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois them , Συνχάρητέ <WG4796> Syncharēte ‘ Rejoice with μοι <WG1473> moi me , ὅτι <WG3754> hoti for εὗρον <WG2147> heuron I have found τὸ <WG3588> to - πρόβατόν <WG4263> probaton sheep ! ’ μου <WG1473> mou my τὸ <WG3588> to - ἀπολωλός <WG622> apolōlos lost

λέγω <WG3004> legō I tell ὑμῖν <WG4771> hymin you ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that οὕτως <WG3779> houtōs In the same way , χαρὰ <WG5479> chara joy ἐν <WG1722> en in τῷ <WG3588> tō - οὐρανῷ <WG3772> ouranō heaven ἔσται <WG1510> estai there will be [more] ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi over ἑνὶ <WG1520> heni one ἁμαρτωλῷ <WG268> hamartōlō sinner μετανοοῦντι <WG3340> metanoounti who repents ἢ <WG2228> ē than ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi over ἐνενήκοντα <WG1768> enenēkonta ninety-nine ἐννέα <WG1767> ennea . . . δικαίοις <WG1342> dikaiois righteous ones οἵτινες <WG3748> hoitines who οὐ <WG3756> ou not χρείαν <WG5532> chreian need ἔχουσιν <WG2192> echousin do μετανοίας <WG3341> metanoias to repent .

( The Parable of the Lost Coin) Ἢ <WG2228> Ē Or τίς <WG5101> tis what γυνὴ <WG1135> gynē woman δραχμὰς <WG1406> drachmas silver coins ( Greek ten drachmas, each worth about a day’s wages) ἔχουσα <WG2192> echousa who has δέκα <WG1176> deka ten ἐὰν <WG1437> ean [and] ἀπολέσῃ <WG622> apolesē loses δραχμὴν <WG1406> drachmēn [of them] μίαν <WG1520> mian one οὐχὶ <WG3780> ouchi does not ἅπτει <WG681> haptei light λύχνον <WG3088> lychnon a lamp , καὶ <WG2532> kai - σαροῖ <WG4563> saroi sweep τὴν <WG3588> tēn [her] οἰκίαν <WG3614> oikian house , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ζητεῖ <WG2212> zētei search ἐπιμελῶς <WG1960> epimelōs carefully ἕως <WG2193> heōs until οὗ <WG3739> hou it ? εὕρῃ <WG2147> heurē she finds

καὶ <WG2532> kai And εὑροῦσα <WG2147> heurousa when she finds [it] , συνκαλεῖ <WG4779> synkalei she calls together τὰς <WG3588> tas [her] φίλας <WG5384> philas friends καὶ <WG2532> kai and γείτονας <WG1069> geitonas neighbors λέγουσα <WG3004> legousa to say , Συνχάρητέ <WG4796> Syncharēte ‘ Rejoice with μοι <WG1473> moi me , ὅτι <WG3754> hoti for εὗρον <WG2147> heuron I have found τὴν <WG3588> tēn [my] δραχμὴν <WG1406> drachmēn coin . ’ ἣν <WG3739> hēn - ἀπώλεσα <WG622> apōlesa lost

οὕτως <WG3779> houtōs In the same way , λέγω <WG3004> legō I tell ὑμῖν <WG4771> hymin you , γίνεται <WG1096> ginetai there is χαρὰ <WG5479> chara joy ἐνώπιον <WG1799> enōpion in the presence τῶν <WG3588> tōn - ἀγγέλων <WG32> angelōn angels τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Θεοῦ <WG2316> Theou of God’s ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi over ἑνὶ <WG1520> heni one ἁμαρτωλῷ <WG268> hamartōlō sinner μετανοοῦντι <WG3340> metanoounti who repents . ”

Εἶπεν <WG2036> Eipen [Jesus] said , ( The Parable of the Prodigal Son) δέ <WG1161> de Then Ἄνθρωπός <WG444> Anthrōpos man τις <WG5100> tis “ [There was] a εἶχεν <WG2192> eichen who had δύο <WG1417> dyo two υἱούς <WG5207> huious sons .

καὶ <WG2532> kai - εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen said ὁ <WG3588> ho The νεώτερος <WG3501> neōteros younger αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn [son] τῷ <WG3588> tō to πατρί <WG3962> patri [him] , Πάτερ <WG3962> Pater ‘ Father , δός <WG1325> dos give μοι <WG1473> moi me τὸ <WG3588> to - ἐπιβάλλον <WG1911> epiballon my μέρος <WG3313> meros share τῆς <WG3588> tēs of the οὐσίας <WG3776> ousias estate . ’ ὁ <WG3588> ho - δὲ <WG1161> de So διεῖλεν <WG1244> dieilen he divided αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois between them . τὸν <WG3588> ton [his] βίον <WG979> bion property

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai - μετ’ <WG3326> met’ After οὐ <WG3756> ou vvv πολλὰς <WG4183> pollas a few ἡμέρας <WG2250> hēmeras days , συναγαγὼν <WG4863> synagagōn got everything together πάντα <WG3956> panta . . . ὁ <WG3588> ho the νεώτερος <WG3501> neōteros younger υἱὸς <WG5207> huios son ἀπεδήμησεν <WG589> apedēmēsen [and] journeyed εἰς <WG1519> eis to χώραν <WG5561> chōran country , μακράν <WG3117> makran a distant καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἐκεῖ <WG1563> ekei [where] διεσκόρπισεν <WG1287> dieskorpisen he squandered τὴν <WG3588> tēn - οὐσίαν <WG3776> ousian wealth αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his ζῶν <WG2198> zōn living . ἀσώτως <WG811> asōtōs in wild

Δαπανήσαντος <WG1159> Dapanēsantos had spent δὲ <WG1161> de After αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou he πάντα <WG3956> panta all [he had] , ἐγένετο <WG1096> egeneto swept λιμὸς <WG3042> limos famine ἰσχυρὰ <WG2478> ischyra a severe κατὰ <WG2596> kata through τὴν <WG3588> tēn - χώραν <WG5561> chōran country , ἐκείνην <WG1565> ekeinēn that καὶ <WG2532> kai and αὐτὸς <WG846> autos he ἤρξατο <WG756> ērxato began ὑστερεῖσθαι <WG5302> hystereisthai to be in need .

καὶ <WG2532> kai [So] πορευθεὶς <WG4198> poreutheis he went ἐκολλήθη <WG2853> ekollēthē [and] hired himself out ἑνὶ <WG1520> heni to a τῶν <WG3588> tōn - πολιτῶν <WG4177> politōn citizen τῆς <WG3588> tēs - χώρας <WG5561> chōras country , ἐκείνης <WG1565> ekeinēs of that καὶ <WG2532> kai [who] ἔπεμψεν <WG3992> epempsen sent αὐτὸν <WG846> auton him εἰς <WG1519> eis into τοὺς <WG3588> tous - ἀγροὺς <WG68> agrous fields αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his βόσκειν <WG1006> boskein to feed χοίρους <WG5519> choirous [the] pigs .

καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἐπεθύμει <WG1937> epethymei He longed γεμίσαι <WG1072> gemisai to fill τὴν <WG3588> tēn - κοιλίαν <WG2836> koilian belly αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his ἐκ <WG1537> ek with τῶν <WG3588> tōn the κερατίων <WG2769> keratiōn pods ὧν <WG3739> hōn - ἤσθιον <WG2068> ēsthion were eating , οἱ <WG3588> hoi the χοῖροι <WG5519> choiroi pigs καὶ <WG2532> kai but οὐδεὶς <WG3762> oudeis no one ἐδίδου <WG1325> edidou would give αὐτῷ <WG846> autō him [ a thing ] .

Εἰς <WG1519> Eis to ἑαυτὸν <WG1438> heauton his senses δὲ <WG1161> de Finally ἐλθὼν <WG2064> elthōn he came ἔφη <WG5346> ephē [and] said , Πόσοι <WG4214> Posoi ‘ How many μίσθιοι <WG3407> misthioi hired servants τοῦ <WG3588> tou of πατρός <WG3962> patros father’s μου <WG1473> mou my περισσεύονται <WG4052> perisseuontai have plenty ἄρτων <WG740> artōn of food ? ἐγὼ <WG1473> egō I am , δὲ <WG1161> de But λιμῷ <WG3042> limō starving ὧδε <WG5602> hōde here ἀπόλλυμαι <WG622> apollymai to death !

ἀναστὰς <WG450> anastas I will get up πορεύσομαι <WG4198> poreusomai [and] go back πρὸς <WG4314> pros to τὸν <WG3588> ton - πατέρα <WG3962> patera father μου <WG1473> mou my καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐρῶ <WG2046> erō say αὐτῷ <WG846> autō to him , Πάτερ <WG3962> Pater “ Father , ἥμαρτον <WG264> hēmarton I have sinned εἰς <WG1519> eis against τὸν <WG3588> ton - οὐρανὸν <WG3772> ouranon heaven καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐνώπιόν <WG1799> enōpion against σου <WG4771> sou you .

οὐκέτι <WG3765> ouketi no longer εἰμὶ <WG1510> eimi I am ἄξιος <WG514> axios worthy κληθῆναι <WG2564> klēthēnai to be called υἱός <WG5207> huios son . σου <WG4771> sou your ποίησόν <WG4160> poiēson Make με <WG1473> me me ὡς <WG5613> hōs like ἕνα <WG1520> hena one τῶν <WG3588> tōn of μισθίων <WG3407> misthiōn hired servants . ”’ σου <WG4771> sou your

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai So ἀναστὰς <WG450> anastas he got up ἦλθεν <WG2064> ēlthen [and] went πρὸς <WG4314> pros to τὸν <WG3588> ton - πατέρα <WG3962> patera father . ἑαυτοῦ <WG1438> heautou his ἔτι <WG2089> eti still δὲ <WG1161> de But while αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou he was μακρὰν <WG3112> makran vvv ἀπέχοντος <WG568> apechontos in the distance , εἶδεν <WG3708> eiden saw αὐτὸν <WG846> auton him ὁ <WG3588> ho - πατὴρ <WG3962> patēr father αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐσπλαγχνίσθη <WG4697> esplanchnisthē was filled with compassion . καὶ <WG2532> kai - δραμὼν <WG5143> dramōn He ran [to his son] , ἐπέπεσεν <WG1968> epepesen embraced him ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi . . . τὸν <WG3588> ton . . . τράχηλον <WG5137> trachēlon . . . , αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou . . . καὶ <WG2532> kai and κατεφίλησεν <WG2705> katephilēsen kissed αὐτόν <WG846> auton him .

Εἶπεν <WG2036> Eipen declared δὲ <WG1161> de - ὁ <WG3588> ho The υἱὸς <WG5207> huios son αὐτῷ <WG846> autō - , Πάτερ <WG3962> Pater ‘ Father , ἥμαρτον <WG264> hēmarton I have sinned εἰς <WG1519> eis against τὸν <WG3588> ton - οὐρανὸν <WG3772> ouranon heaven καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐνώπιόν <WG1799> enōpion against σου <WG4771> sou you . οὐκέτι <WG3765> ouketi no longer εἰμὶ <WG1510> eimi I am ἄξιος <WG514> axios worthy κληθῆναι <WG2564> klēthēnai to be called υἱός <WG5207> huios son . ’ ( WH includes Make me like one of your hired servants; see verse 19.) σου <WG4771> sou your

Εἶπεν <WG2036> Eipen said δὲ <WG1161> de But ὁ <WG3588> ho the πατὴρ <WG3962> patēr father πρὸς <WG4314> pros to τοὺς <WG3588> tous - δούλους <WG1401> doulous servants , αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his Ταχὺ <WG5035> Tachy ‘ Quick ! ἐξενέγκατε <WG1627> exenenkate Bring στολὴν <WG4749> stolēn robe τὴν <WG3588> tēn the πρώτην <WG4413> prōtēn best καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐνδύσατε <WG1746> endysate put it on αὐτόν <WG846> auton him . καὶ <WG2532> kai - δότε <WG1325> dote Put δακτύλιον <WG1146> daktylion a ring εἰς <WG1519> eis on τὴν <WG3588> tēn - χεῖρα <WG5495> cheira finger αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his καὶ <WG2532> kai and ὑποδήματα <WG5266> hypodēmata sandals εἰς <WG1519> eis on τοὺς <WG3588> tous his πόδας <WG4228> podas feet .

καὶ <WG2532> kai - φέρετε <WG5342> pherete Bring τὸν <WG3588> ton the μόσχον <WG3448> moschon calf τὸν <WG3588> ton - σιτευτόν <WG4618> siteuton fattened θύσατε <WG2380> thysate [and] kill [it] . καὶ <WG2532> kai - φαγόντες <WG5315> phagontes Let us feast εὐφρανθῶμεν <WG2165> euphranthōmen [and] celebrate .

ὅτι <WG3754> hoti For οὗτος <WG3778> houtos this ὁ <WG3588> ho - υἱός <WG5207> huios son μου <WG1473> mou of mine νεκρὸς <WG3498> nekros dead ἦν <WG1510> ēn was καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀνέζησεν <WG326> anezēsen is alive again ! ἦν <WG1510> ēn He was ἀπολωλὼς <WG622> apolōlōs lost καὶ <WG2532> kai and εὑρέθη <WG2147> heurethē is found ! ’ καὶ <WG2532> kai So ἤρξαντο <WG756> ērxanto they began εὐφραίνεσθαι <WG2165> euphrainesthai to celebrate .

Ἦν <WG1510> Ēn was δὲ <WG1161> de Meanwhile ὁ <WG3588> ho - υἱὸς <WG5207> huios son αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou - ὁ <WG3588> ho the πρεσβύτερος <WG4245> presbyteros older ἐν <WG1722> en in ἀγρῷ <WG68> agrō [the] field , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ὡς <WG5613> hōs as ἐρχόμενος <WG2064> erchomenos he approached ἤγγισεν <WG1448> ēngisen . . . τῇ <WG3588> tē the οἰκίᾳ <WG3614> oikia house , ἤκουσεν <WG191> ēkousen he heard συμφωνίας <WG4858> symphōnias music καὶ <WG2532> kai and χορῶν <WG5525> chorōn dancing .

καὶ <WG2532> kai So προσκαλεσάμενος <WG4341> proskalesamenos he called ἕνα <WG1520> hena one τῶν <WG3588> tōn of the παίδων <WG3816> paidōn servants ἐπυνθάνετο <WG4441> epynthaneto [and] asked τί <WG5101> ti what ἂν <WG302> an . . . εἴη <WG1510> eiē . . . . ταῦτα <WG3778> tauta was going on

Ὁ <WG3588> Ho - δὲ <WG1161> de - εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen he said αὐτῷ <WG846> autō - ὅτι <WG3754> hoti - , Ὁ <WG3588> Ho - ἀδελφός <WG80> adelphos brother σου <WG4771> sou ‘ Your ἥκει <WG2240> hēkei has returned , ’ καὶ <WG2532> kai ‘ and ἔθυσεν <WG2380> ethysen has killed ὁ <WG3588> ho - πατήρ <WG3962> patēr father σου <WG4771> sou your τὸν <WG3588> ton the μόσχον <WG3448> moschon calf , τὸν <WG3588> ton - σιτευτόν <WG4618> siteuton fattened ὅτι <WG3754> hoti because ὑγιαίνοντα <WG5198> hygiainonta safe and sound . ’ αὐτὸν <WG846> auton . . . ἀπέλαβεν <WG618> apelaben he has him back

Ὠργίσθη <WG3710> Ōrgisthē [The older son] became angry δὲ <WG1161> de - καὶ <WG2532> kai and οὐκ <WG3756> ouk vvv ἤθελεν <WG2309> ēthelen refused εἰσελθεῖν <WG1525> eiselthein to go in . ὁ <WG3588> ho - δὲ <WG1161> de So πατὴρ <WG3962> patēr father αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his ἐξελθὼν <WG1831> exelthōn came out παρεκάλει <WG3870> parekalei [and] pleaded with αὐτόν <WG846> auton him .

Ὁ <WG3588> Ho - δὲ <WG1161> de But ἀποκριθεὶς <WG611> apokritheis he answered εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen . . . τῷ <WG3588> tō . . . πατρὶ <WG3962> patri father , ‹αὐτοῦ› <WG846> autou his Ἰδοὺ <WG2400> Idou ‘ Look , τοσαῦτα <WG5118> tosauta all these ἔτη <WG2094> etē years δουλεύω <WG1398> douleuō I have served σοι <WG4771> soi you καὶ <WG2532> kai and οὐδέποτε <WG3763> oudepote never ἐντολήν <WG1785> entolēn a commandment σου <WG4771> sou of yours . παρῆλθον <WG3928> parēlthon disobeyed καὶ <WG2532> kai Yet ἐμοὶ <WG1473> emoi me οὐδέποτε <WG3763> oudepote vvv ἔδωκας <WG1325> edōkas you never gave ἔριφον <WG2056> eriphon [even] a young goat ἵνα <WG2443> hina so μετὰ <WG3326> meta with τῶν <WG3588> tōn - φίλων <WG5384> philōn friends . μου <WG1473> mou my εὐφρανθῶ <WG2165> euphranthō I could celebrate
